dialogues.narrative: Huh? What’s that sound? It’s making my ears hurt.
You're finally awake! There's an urgent matter that needs your attention, PLAYER.
Are the others awake?
Yes they are on the way to the command center. The passengers are still sleeping; the alarm is only rang in the crew quarters.
Don't forget bring your keycard and wear your uniform.

choices.systemLog: On the back of the card, you see a code: 0206
You wear your uniform. It feels comfortable and ready for action.
Attempting to login into the system...

puzzle.description: Enter the code to unlock the door.
puzzle.successMessage: Attempting to login into the system...
puzzle.failureMessage: The code is incorrect. Try again.

dialogues.narrative: Welcome to the system, PLAYER. Here you can find information about the ship, system logs, and more.

choices.systemLog: System logs appear here. You can review past events and actions taken by your choices.
NUR 10 is a spaceship designed for interstellar space travel. We are onroute to Caelus Prime, to ferry passengers and crew to their new home.
Shuttle integrity is the current status and information about your shuttle.
SITI is an intelligent AI system designed to assist the crew of NUR 10.

dialogues.narrative: Have you familarized yourself with the system, PLAYER?

choices.option: Yes, I have. Let's go to the command center.

dialogues.narrative: Ah, PLAYER! There you are. We were starting to think you’d sleep through the whole alarm.
Glad to see my reputation precedes me. What’s going on?
Captain, I’m picking up a signal. It’s encrypted — old Earth military code. Not standard colony traffic.
What does it say?
It's encrypted, but it's definitely a distress signal.
Is it meant for us?
I think so. It has our ship’s name in the data... but from before we launched. Someone knew exactly where we’d be.
“I’ve seen this type of encryption before. It’s complicated — hidden inside older code so it looks harmless.
It could be a trap, or worse a virus. We open it and risk the whole ship.
Maybe. But we can’t ignore it. We need to find out who sent it and why.
I will keep it isolated and run in a safe environment. If it's dangerous, I can contain it.
Sounds good.
What do you think, SITI?
I can try to decode it, but it might take some time. I’ll need access to the mainframe.

choices.systemLog: You decided to take a look at the message yourself.

choices.option: Read the rest of the message
choices.systemLog: The rest of the message reads: 'We never left. No memories, no past. We are the ghosts of NUR 10.'

dialogues.narrative: I successfully decoded the some of the message. Maybe you can help me with the rest, PLAYER?
The message is decoded. It reads: 'To: Cap. PLAYER - We never left. ROOT AT 7°N / 118°E. No memories, no past. We are the ghosts of NUR 10.'
What is this?
I don't know, but it sounds ominous.
It reads like a part warning, part riddle. Coordinates maybe? Seven north, one-eighteen east? Could be planetary — or orbital.
Why do they use 'we' and 'ghosts'? They sound like they know us, but we don’t know them.
Or they are us. We never left... Could mean a loop. A time loop, or a memory wipe.
A memory wipe? That’s... unsettling. But we can’t ignore it. If this from a version of our mission that failed, then we are flying straight to the same mistake.
Captain... the signal's timestamp says it's two years from now.

choices.option: Siti, can you decode the coordinates?
Decode the rest of the message
